sentence.Network_en: All is grist that comes to his mill.
sentence.Network_cn: 〔谚语〕到他磨里的东西全会变成粉,他善于利用一切事物.

sentence.Network_en: This item, commonplace enough in the usual grist of summer accidents, interested Clyde only slightly.
sentence.Network_cn: 这段新闻在夏天经常发生的事故当中, 是一件很普通的新闻, 克莱德并不怎么注意.

sentence.Network_en: I never refuse odd jobs to supplement my income it's all grist to the mill.
sentence.Network_cn: 我为增加收入,对于做零活总是来者不拒--多多益善.

phrase.cizu_name: grist for (one's) mill 或 grist for the mill

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English grinding', of Germanic origin; related to grind

entry.tran: 对…有用的东西（或有利的事）
entry.def: If you say that something is grist to the mill, you mean that it is useful for a particular purpose or helps support someone's point of view.

means.word_mean: 1. grain intended to be or that has been ground
